meanings.definition: To exceed in bulk or size.
meanings.sent1: The large elephant outbulked the tiny mouse.
meanings.sent2: The blue whale outbulked all the other sea creatures.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant tried to outbulk the big bear in a size contest.
meanings.sent4: The mountain outbulked the surrounding hills, standing tall and majestic.
meanings.sent5: The giant pumpkin outbulked all the other vegetables at the fair.

meanings.definition: To surpass in physical size or weight.
meanings.sent1: The heavyweight boxer outbulked his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent2: The massive boulder outbulked the smaller rocks in the field.
meanings.sent3: The sumo wrestler tried to outbulk his opponent by eating more rice.
meanings.sent4: The huge ship outbulked all the other boats in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The oversized backpack outbulked the tiny purse, making it difficult to carry.
